intro: Vilfa scabra, commonly known as the rough vilfa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period usually occurs during the summer months, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
